text:
*[Bug 18973] New: Replacment in 1d-arrays using names looses dimension*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18973>

            Bug ID: 18973
           Summary: Replacment in 1d-arrays using names looses dimension
           Product: R
           Version: R-devel (trunk)
          Hardware: All
                OS: All
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Misc
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr|Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr>

(I'm not sure if it's intended or if it's a bug. Apologies if it's not.)

Replacment in 1d-arrays using names looses dimension:

```
n <- 1:3
x <- array(n, dimnames = list(letters[n]))

x[1] <- 999
str(x)
#  num [1:3(1d)] 999 2 3
#  - attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 1
#   ..$ : chr [1:3] "a" "b" "c"

x["b"] <- 999
str(x)
#  Named num [1:3] 999 999 3
#  - attr(*, "names")= chr [1:3] "a" "b" "c"
```

I noticed that while working with table():

```
tbl <- table(letters[1:3])

tbl[1] <- 99
str(tbl)
#  'table' num [1:3(1d)] 99 1 1
#  - attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 1
#   ..$ : chr [1:3] "a" "b" "c"

tbl["b"] <- 99
str(tbl)
#  'table' Named num [1:3] 99 99 1
#  - attr(*, "names")= chr [1:3] "a" "b" "c"
```

text:
*[Bug 18974] New: tools::Rdiff(nullPointers=TRUE) does not convert glibc's (nil)*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18974>

            Bug ID: 18974
           Summary: tools::Rdiff(nullPointers=TRUE) does not convert
                    glibc's (nil)
           Product: R
           Version: R-devel (trunk)
          Hardware: Other
                OS: Other
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Language
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:jaganmn@mcmaster.ca|jaganmn@mcmaster.ca>

Created attachment 3570
  --> <https://bugs.r-project.org/attachment.cgi?id=3570&action=edit>
`00check.log` showing false positive NOTE

The glibc implementation of `printf("%p", (void *) 0)` gives `(nil)` as output
rather than `0x0` or similar; see, e.g.,
<https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Other-Output-Conversions.html>.
 This `(nil)` is not detected by the pattern used by
`tools::Rdiff(nullPointers=TRUE)`, and as a result lines with `<pointer:
(nil)>` compare as different from lines with `<pointer: 0x0>` or similar.

I attach a `00check.log` produced by R-universe reporting the false positive
differences.  The following one-line patch solves it:

```
Index: src/library/tools/R/testing.R
===================================================================
--- src/library/tools/R/testing.R       (revision 89071)
+++ src/library/tools/R/testing.R       (working copy)
@@ -180,7 +180,7 @@
         if (nullPointers) {
             ## remove pointer addresses from listings
             ## useBytes=TRUE as some tests intentionally use invalid strings
-            txt <- gsub("<(environment|bytecode|pointer|promise):
[x[:xdigit:]]+>", "<\\1: 0>", txt,
+            txt <- gsub("<(environment|bytecode|pointer|promise):
([x[:xdigit:]]+|[(]nil[)])>", "<\\1: 0>", txt,
                         useBytes = TRUE)
             ## standardize hashtable, pro tem
             ## useBytes=TRUE as some tests intentionally use invalid strings
```

When I get a moment, I'll provide a patch that includes a minimal test ...

             ## useBytes=TRUE as some tests intentionally use invalid strings

text:
*[Bug 18970] wrapper around `proportions()` to ease publication-like table preparation [with patch]*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18970>

--- Comment #1 from Thomas Soeiro (<mailto:Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr|Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr>) ---
Depending on what is decided regarding bug 18973, the following line in
suggested patch:

```
dn_nona <- lapply(dimnames(x), stats::na.omit)
```

can be changed to:

```
dn_nona <- lapply(dimnames(x), \(x) !<http://is.na|is.na>(x))
```

to prevent loosing dimension of 1d arrays.

elements.text: to ease publication-like table preparation [with patch]
to prevent loosing dimension of 1d arrays.

text:
*[Bug 18974] tools::Rdiff(nullPointers=TRUE) does not convert glibc's (nil)*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18974>

--- Comment #1 from Mikael Jagan (<mailto:jaganmn@mcmaster.ca|jaganmn@mcmaster.ca>) ---
Created attachment 3571
  --> <https://bugs.r-project.org/attachment.cgi?id=3571&action=edit>
tools::Rdiff(nullPointers=TRUE) converting glibc's (nil)

OK, here is a patch adding a regression test, where I point out that the false
positive differences are in fact only detected and reported when `<pointer:
(nil)>` or similar is not a leading substring, which is consistent with the
check log attached earlier.

elements.text:
tools::Rdiff(nullPointers=TRUE) converting glibc's (nil)

OK, here is a patch adding a regression test, where I point out that the false
positive differences are in fact only detected and reported when `<pointer:
(nil)>` or similar is not a leading substring, which is consistent with the
check log attached earlier.

text:
*[Bug 18975] New: 'provideDimnames' optionally providing names(dimnames(.))*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18975>

            Bug ID: 18975
           Summary: 'provideDimnames' optionally providing
                    names(dimnames(.))
           Product: R
           Version: R-devel (trunk)
          Hardware: Other
                OS: Other
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Wishlist
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:jaganmn@mcmaster.ca|jaganmn@mcmaster.ca>

When creating examples and tests for R and R packages, it is very common that I
want to construct an array with dimnames and in particular *named* dimnames, as
these names are often not handled rigorously by code.  A very recent example is
bug 18972, and an older example is bug 18494.

It would be nice if `provideDimnames` could gain a logical argument, say
`use.names`, such that (where `y = provideDimnames(x, base=, use.names=)`):

* If `use.names = FALSE`, then `names(dimnames(y))` is identical to
`names(dimnames(x))`, as currently.
* If `use.names = TRUE`, then `names(dimnames(y))` is created from
`names(dimnames(x))` and `names(base)`, the former taking precedence over the
latter where nonempty (not `""`).

For backwards compatibility, the default value of `use.names` would be `FALSE`.

If the above proposal (or some modification of it - I am not opinionated about
the details) seems desirable then I will submit a patch for the code and
documentation.

text:
*[Bug 18972] diff(x=<m-by-n>, l, d) drops dimensions when l*d >= m*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18972>

--- Comment #5 from Suharto Anggono (<mailto:suharto_anggono@yahoo.com|suharto_anggono@yahoo.com>) ---
Created attachment 3572
  --> <https://bugs.r-project.org/attachment.cgi?id=3572&action=edit>
No early return for lag * differences >= xlen

Another option, except for `"ts"` method, is not returning early if

    lag * differences >= xlen

. A side effect is that, for `"Date"` and `"POSIXt"` methods, `units` argument
is also respected for empty result.
